Title: Neige
Writer: Juliet Berto (adaptation), Juliet Berto (idea), Jean-Henri Roger (adaptation), Marc Villard (dialogue), Marc Villard (scenario)
Actors: Juliet Berto, Jean-François Stévenin, Robert Liensol, Patrick Chesnais
Plot: An illustration of the more or less weird people in the nightlife of the revel region of a French town. In the center of the (almost non-existing) plot are barmaid Anita and a reverend. Anita cares for the Caribbean dealer Bobby like a mother, but he's too cool to listen to her warnings. When he's caught by the police, Anita has pity for her friends who are without "neige" (snow, probably cocaine) now, and tries to help them out.
